title.narrative: SN_DRF
Effective coordination mechanisms and tools are in place for UN System to deliver gender equality commitments
Percentage of UN SWAP-Gender Scorecard recommendations implemented by UNCT

Number of joint programmes and joint advocacy initiatives that UN Women leads/coordinates and participates in to support GE priorities identified in the UN Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework and the Joint Work Plans
Systemic constraints hindering women’s economic empowerment are reduced, and positive business practices are implemented to transform the gender bias in the world of work.
Existence of a comprehensive service provision model for WEPs signatories to achieve their Gender Equality commitments
Number of multi-stakeholder coalitions for policy advocacy on key issues constraining women`s equal access to labor market and decent work
Targeted women in leadership positions are empowered with leadership skills and knowledge on GEWE commitments to effectively undertake their duties
Availability of new research and knowledge products in key areas (such as VAWiP, voter analysis etc.)
Number of women MPs and candidates at national / local level with strengthened capacities to engage in political life with UN Women support
Number of women MPs and candidates at national / local level with strengthened capacities to engage in political life with UN Women support

Number of gender analysis of legislation, parliamentary practices and other gender equality initiatives developed and or implemented by parliamentary bodies (the Equal Opportunities Commission, Strategy Development Department, etc.)

Number of gender analysis of legislation, parliamentary practices and other gender equality initiatives developed and or implemented by parliamentary bodies (the Equal Opportunities Commission, Strategy Development Department, etc.)
Number of gender equality initiatives developed and/or being implemented by parliamentary bodies, with UN-Women's support
Number of municipalities supported by UN Women to develop and apply gender sensitive social risk maps
Number of women leaders with strengthened capacities on gender responsive budgeting and planning
Number of networks established and/or strengthened among women in politics and the political aspirants supported
Number of women leaders, candidates and aspirants at local level with strengthened capacities to engage in political life with UN Women support
Key line ministries, parliament and local governments have enhanced awareness and capacity to develop and apply Gender – Responsive Budgeting (GRB) tools in planning and budgeting
Number of Municipal staff with enhanced capacity on GRB
Number of MoFLSS, SBP, Ministry of Treasury and Finance (MoTF), other ministries and/or affiliated public organizations’s staff with enhanced capacity on GRB
Number of MPs with enhanced awareness on GRB
Number of national and local policy or performance documents supported by UN Women that include gender responsive components
Number of national and local policy or performance documents supported by UN Women that include gender responsive components
Number of policy documents, circulars and guidelines of SBP on budgeting processes with specific GRB references
Number of staff with enhanced capacity to integrate gender budgeting in public finance systems, with UN Women’s support
Number of staff with enhanced capacity to integrate gender budgeting in public finance systems, with UN Women’s support
Women, girls and gender equality advocates have increased capacities and opportunities to exercise their voice, leadership and agency
(UNSDCF JWP Output Indicator) Number of women leaders, candidates, and aspirants at local level with strengthened capacities to engage in political life with UN Women support

(UNSDCF JWP Output Indicator) Number of networks, alliances, intergenerational platforms and CSOs established and/or supported by UN for enhanced advocacy, dialogue and solidarity including their participation and voice in treaty bodies
Capacities are enhanced, and new products and service models are made available to advance gender-responsive laws, policies and institutions in line with global normative frameworks
Number of national and/or local (multi)sectoral strategies, policies and/or action plans and policy making tools with a focus on gender equality developed and revised with UN Women support

Services on VAW prevention and protection are improved through strengthened capacities of institutions, improved data management , better coordination and empowerment of women at risk and survivors of VAW.

Number of service providers (public institutions, CSOs and municipalities) with enhanced institutional capabilities on prevention and the provision of quality services for survivors with support of UN Women.

(UNSDCF JWP Output Indicator) Number of professionals from governmental and non-governmental institutions trained on violence against women and girls, protection and gender mainstreaming in line with the national and international legal framework

Favourable social norms, attitudes and behaviours are promoted at individual, community and institutional levels towards gender equality and preventing discrimination and violence against women and girls.

(UNSDCF JWP Output Indicator) Number of men and boys participating in trainings and community level activities those promote women’s rights, gender equality and address the discrimination and violence against women and girls.
(UNSDCF JWP Output Indicator) Number of initiatives undertaken by UA Chapter to challenge gender stereotypes in media and advertising

(UNSDCF JWP Output Indicator) Number of participants UN-supported training programmes (i.e. the Gender Equality Academy, trainings for the media professionals, teachers etc.) with increase in the knowledge of gender equality and women’s empowerment

(UNSDCF JWP Output Indicator) Number of people who have been delivered with messages challenging harmful gender stereotypes and promoting elimination of violence against women and girls, including child, early and forced marriage through social and behavi
